data.title: More than 20K federal workers accept resignation offer - report
data.description:
More than 20K federal employees, or ~1% of the federal government workforce, have taken up the offer to quit their jobs in a deferred resignation program, and the numbers are expected to spike as the Thursday deadline approaches, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday, citing an administration official.

Under the program, the employees agree to resign, but they'll be paid and receive benefits until Sept. 30, 2025. When the offer was unveiled last week, officials expected that 5%-10% of those eligible would accept it.

That target could be difficult, Bloomberg said. The government has almost 2.3M civilian federal employees, but perhaps half of them aren't eligible for the offer. The program excludes postal workers, law enforcement employees, and civilian defense and intelligence personnel, as well as certain other sensitive roles.

Meanwhile, federal employee units have told their members to be skeptical of the offers, which they said aren't guaranteed.

Dear readers: We recognize that politics often intersects with the financial news of the day, so we invite you to click here to join the separate political discussion.

data.title: Enterprise Products says not enough customer interest for Sea Port crude export project
data.description:
Enterprise Product Partners (NYSE:EPD) -1% in Tuesday's trading after reporting better than expected Q4 earnings on higher natural gas pipeline volumes, but the company said it has not received enough customer interest to commercialize its Sea Port Oil Terminal crude export project.

"In order to build SPOT, we know what we need is volumes, fees and terms... if we can't achieve these within a reasonable amount of time, we will move on," Enterprise (NYSE:EPD) CEO Jim Teague said on the company's earnings conference call.

Teague cited regulatory delays and Russia's 2022 invasion of Ukraine, which rerouted oil flows, for the lack of interest in SPOT, adding that Enterprise (EPD) will continue to promote the project.

In 2022, SPOT was the first export terminal project to receive a U.S. license for a deepwater port that could load two supertankers, each of which can carry up to 2M barrels of oil at a time.

Q4 earnings edged higher to $1.63B, or $0.74/unit, from $1.6B, or $0.72/unit, in the year-earlier quarter, but revenues fell 2.9% Y/Y to $14.2B, with the company citing investments in its Permian Basin pipelines and downstream infrastructure for increased volumes.

Higher volumes led to a 12% Y/Y increase in Q4 gross operating margin to $1.5B at Enterprise's (EPD) natural gas liquids pipeline and services unit.

"A lot has changed since we entered our SPOT application in January 2019," when forecasters were predicting U.S. crude exports would climb to 7M-8M bbl/day by 2024, and that a majority of those would go to Asia on supertankers, Teague said on the call.

The latest data from the Energy Information Administration showed U.S. crude exports averaged ~4.1M bbl/day in the first 11 months of 2024.

Data from ship tracking data from Kpler showed 47% of U.S. crude exports went to Europe during the period, as Russia's invasion of Ukraine led to higher demand from Europe, while Asia's share of U.S. crude exports dropped to 38% in 2024 from 43% in 2019.

Crude oil for Europe can be shipped economically in smaller tankers, while increased demand from Asia would have led to more use of supertankers, the type that SPOT had targeted for its project.

data.title: AeroVironment rises after securing part of $990M of Army deal
data.description:
AeroVironment’s (NASDAQ:AVAV) stock on Tuesday rose as much as 9.2%, a day after the maker of military drones said it was awarded its third delivery order of $288 million for Switchblade loitering munitions.

The delivery is part of a five-year contract with a maximum value of $990 million, as announced in August.

data.title: Ford Q4 2024 Earnings Preview: Inventory, pricing concerns under spotlight
data.description:
Ford (NYSE:F) is scheduled to announce Q4 earnings results on Wednesday, February 5th, after market close.

Wells Fargo expects Ford (F) to report below consensus given production, pricing, seasonal and EV mix headwinds. For 2025, it foresees tariff risks and the likely end of IRA-funded EV buyer credits to hurt the automaker and the larger industry.

RBC Capital Markets also maintained a cautious view on Ford and the overall U.S. automotive sector, but still expects slightly above consensus thanks to stronger retail sales for Q4. For 2025, it expects Ford to downshift earnings and revenue expectations.

Investors will be keenly looking at elevated deal inventory levels, especially given Q1 is seasonally a weak quarter, and how much prices will come down because of it.

Barclays also expects Q4 beats from Ford, but 2025 guidance may come in below expectations. Elevated volume headwinds will impact 2025 due to inventory destocking and continued price normalization will drive downside earnings estimates..

The consensus EPS Estimate is $0.32 (+10.3% Y/Y) and the consensus Revenue Estimate is $42.83B (-6.9% Y/Y).

Over the last 2 years, F has beaten EPS estimates 63% of the time and has beaten revenue estimates 75% of the time.

Over the last 3 months, EPS estimates have seen 4 upward revisions and 5 downward. Revenue estimates have seen 2 upward revisions and 3 downward.

data.title: Robinhood suspends Super Bowl betting contracts after CFTC request
data.description:
Robinhood Markets (NASDAQ:HOOD) suspended the rollout of the Pro Football Championship market after a formal request by the U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission not to give customers access to sports event contracts, the retail trading app said on Tuesday.

The Super Bowl product, launched Monday, has already been introduced to about 1% of its customers, Robinhood (NASDAQ:HOOD) said in a statement. Customers who already placed bets in the contracts will get the option to close their position.

"We are disappointed by this outcome, especially given that we had been in regular communication with the CFTC about our intent and plans to offer this product."

The company noted its derivatives unit will continue to work with the CFTC as "a more comprehensive event contracts platform" is set for launch later in the year.

Robinhood (HOOD) shares gained 2% in afternoon trading.

data.title: TMX targets growth with Trayport expansion and launches AlphaX US in Q1 2025
data.description:
Earnings Call Insights: TMX Group Limited (OTCPK:TMXXF) Q4 2024

Management View

  • CEO John McKenzie highlighted a robust Q4 performance, with revenue increasing 30% year-over-year, supported by notable growth across Global Solutions, Insights, and Analytics (GSIA), Derivatives Trading and Clearing, and TMX Trayport. He emphasized progress in expanding TMX Trayport into new geographies and asset classes such as climate markets, North American power, and Japanese power.
  • TMX Trayport recorded a 22% annual revenue increase, fueled by a 25% rise in total licensees and enhanced analytics offerings. McKenzie noted Trayport's network now includes over 370 trading firms across 40 countries, with its Joule platform playing a pivotal role in global energy markets.
  • Capital Formation revenue increased 2% year-over-year, boosted by the acquisition of Newsfile and successful listings like Group Dynamite's $2.2B IPO. TMX continues to strengthen its international footprint with 50% of its pipeline originating from outside Canada.
  • CFO David Arnold reported $393.3M in Q4 revenue, with 17% organic growth excluding acquisitions. Adjusted diluted EPS increased 30% from the prior year, reflecting strong operational performance and higher income from operations.

Outlook

  • McKenzie emphasized the company's focus on executing key initiatives in 2025, including the continued expansion of TMX Trayport and the recent launch of AlphaX US, a new equity ATS platform designed to improve execution for U.S. broker-dealers.
  • The company’s post-trade modernization project is on schedule for completion by the end of Q1 2025, pending regulatory approvals. This initiative is expected to enhance operational efficiency and introduce new post-trade solutions.
  • TMX VettaFi is targeting further growth by expanding its product offerings and geographic reach, with a focus on European and Asian markets through its recent iNDEX Research acquisition.

Financial Results

  • TMX achieved a 30% year-over-year increase in Q4 revenue, reaching $393.3M, with notable contributions from GSIA and Trayport. GSIA revenue grew 48%, bolstered by the inclusion of TMX VettaFi and strong growth in Trayport.
  • Adjusted diluted EPS rose 30% year-over-year to $0.58, driven by higher operating income and a favorable foreign exchange impact.
  • Derivatives Trading and Clearing revenue excluding BOX grew 17%, supported by record volumes in interest rate products and ETF options. Montreal Exchange volumes increased 13%, with open interest up 51% year-over-year as of December 31, 2024.
  • TMX VettaFi recorded an 18% revenue increase in U.S. dollars for the year, with assets under management reaching $51.9B, including contributions from the iNDEX Research acquisition.

Q&A

  • Étienne Ricard, BMO Capital Markets, asked about the drivers behind Trayport's growth. CFO David Arnold explained that existing clients expanding their use of premium products were the primary contributors, complemented by new client acquisitions.
  • Benjamin Budish, Barclays, inquired about VettaFi's Q4 revenue trends. McKenzie attributed the quarter's variability to client-driven timing differences in digital distribution deals, emphasizing the business's recurring revenue strength.
  • Graham Ryding, TD Securities, questioned Trayport’s addressable market. McKenzie noted sustained growth in Europe and early-stage opportunities in the U.S. and Far East markets, including Japan Power.
  • Aravinda Galappatthige, Canaccord Genuity, asked about synergies from the iNDEX Research acquisition. McKenzie highlighted new European operational capabilities and the potential for cross-selling with existing TMX VettaFi products.

Sentiment Analysis

  • Analysts expressed optimism about Trayport’s growth trajectory and the scalability of TMX VettaFi, though some sought clarification on quarterly revenue variability.
  • Management maintained a confident tone, particularly regarding Trayport’s global expansion and the potential of its new AlphaX US platform. McKenzie’s statements conveyed strategic clarity, while Arnold emphasized disciplined expense management and robust operational performance.
  • Compared to Q3, management’s tone reflected heightened confidence in executing 2025 initiatives, particularly in post-trade modernization and U.S. market expansion.

Quarter-over-Quarter Comparison

  • Q4 saw a significant revenue increase of $39.5M sequentially, with growth across all operating segments. GSIA led the gains, supported by TMX VettaFi and Trayport.
  • Adjusted diluted EPS growth of 30% in Q4 exceeded the 17% increase reported in Q3, reflecting stronger operating leverage.
  • Management sentiment appeared more forward-focused, emphasizing 2025 initiatives such as AlphaX US and Trayport’s geographic expansion, compared to Q3’s emphasis on foundational growth.
  • Analysts’ questions shifted toward understanding revenue sustainability and the scalability of recent acquisitions, indicating a heightened focus on long-term growth opportunities.

Risks and Concerns

  • Management acknowledged potential challenges from global economic conditions and regulatory changes, particularly in the U.S. equity trading market.
  • Analysts raised concerns about revenue lumpiness in VettaFi’s digital distribution business and the impact of interest rate fluctuations on TSX Trust.
  • TMX’s mitigation strategies include expanding recurring revenue streams, diversifying geographically, and leveraging acquisitions to enhance operational capabilities.

Final Takeaway

TMX Group Limited delivered robust Q4 results, highlighted by strong growth in GSIA and Trayport. The company is poised for further expansion in 2025, supported by key initiatives such as AlphaX US and post-trade modernization. With recurring revenue from Trayport and VettaFi growing steadily, TMX is focusing on geographic diversification and leveraging recent acquisitions to sustain its growth trajectory.

Read the full Earnings Call Transcript
